conditions.chemicals_used: CuCl2 (19 mg, 0.14 mmol), 4-(aminomethyl)benzoic acid (44 mg, 0.29 mmol)
CuCl2 (19 mg, 0.14 mmol), 3-(aminopropyl)phosphonic acid (40 mg, 0.29 mmol)
Taurine (75 mg, 0.60 mmol), anhydrous CuCl2 (40 mg, 0.30 mmol)
conditions.notes: Product is unstable outside of the mother liquor

conditions.chemicals_used: Taurine (75 mg, 0.60 mmol), anhydrous CuCl2 (0.30 mmol)
Taurine (75 mg, 0.60 mmol), anhydrous MnCl2 (76 mg, 0.60 mmol)
Taurine (0.60 mmol, 75 mg), CuCl2 (0.30 mmol, 40 mg)
conditions.cooling_method: slowly cooled to room temperature, left to stand for 3-4 days

conditions.chemicals_used: CuCl (17 mg, 0.17 mmol), In2O3 (24 mg, 0.086 mmol), phenethylamine (180 µl, 1.4 mmol), H3PO2 (60 µl, 50 wt. % solution in H2O)
conditions.cooling_method: Quickly cooled while stirring or slowly cooled at a controlled rate of 4 °C/h

conditions.chemicals_used: CuCl (11 mg, 0.11 mmol), In2O3 (16 mg, 0.057 mmol), histamine (53 mg, 0.48 mmol), H3PO2 (35 µl, 50 wt% solution in H2O)
conditions.time: Until solids dissolved, then purged with N2 for 40 min, reheated to dissolve previously formed crystals, additional H3PO2 added, purged with N2 for 1 h at room temperature and then for 15 min while heating
conditions.cooling_method: Slowly cooled to room temperature at 2 °C/h, left undisturbed for 4 days
Transferred to a Teflon-capped vapor diffusion chamber with diethyl ether as the antisolvent, left to stand in the dark for several days

conditions.chemicals_used: Aminoethanethiol hydrochloride (140 mg, 12 mmol), lead(II) acetate trihydrate (230 mg, 6.2 mmol), lead(II) chloride (170 mg, 6.2 mmol)
conditions.time: Until solids dissolved, then heated for 10 min
conditions.cooling_method: Slowly cooled over the course of 12 h
